mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Martha Washington to Bartholomew Dandridge, Sr., 1778 November 2
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Martha, 1731-1802
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Martha writes that she is sorry that mama is ill -- glad she recovered -- expect she will take another trip to the northward -- the "pore General is not likely to come to see us" -- if she stays home hopes to see him soon -- sends Patty a kiss and pair of shoes -- not a doll in the city of Philadelphia -- has had no letter since Washington came from camp -- duty to Mama, love to sister Aylett [Elizabeth Dandridge Aylett, later to marry Henley] sister and family. Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, laminated, incomplete watermark (powder horn & GR). | Papers of George Washington - Reel#1
